alert.note: Alert for Franklin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 4:27AM EST until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Louisburg affecting Franklin County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tar River at Louisburg. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Bankfull in the vicinity of Main Street. Minor flooding begins in River Bend Park 0.1 miles upstream of Main Street. At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Banks overflow at Main Street. River Bend Park is flooded and storm drains are inundated along the river. At 22.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Flooding begins in Pruitt and Shannon Villages on the east side of town. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EST Thursday was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.6 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.0 feet on 11/14/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tar River Louisbur 20.0 20.1 Thu 4 am EST 16.5 11.4 9.8 8.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM EST.
